messageBody:
(Replying to several posts)

> From: Scott Stirling
>
> Why not just extend TestCase with specialized, re-usable,
> TestCase types?

> From: Mike Clark
>
> For what it's worth, I generally create separate, custom assertion
> classes. That is, rather than using inheritance, I use delegation.
> That way each specific test case can pick and choose which custom
> assertions it needs.

And following on that, you can use a combination of both methods. Each
time you develop custom assetions, put them in a separate custom
assertion class. This will give you a better reusability base. If you
find that many of your application tests use these or other custom
assertions, you can create a custom base TestCase for convenience, which
just delegates the calls to to your custom assetion class/es (a la
junit.framework.Testcase).

Manuel Amago.
